com.qtplaf.library.task

Interface Task

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileCopy, FileScanner, SampleTask, TaskAverages, TaskClusterKMeans, TaskCopy, TaskDownloadTicker, TaskNormalize, TaskPatterns, TaskRanges, TaskRunner, TaskRunnerList, TaskRunnerThreads, TaskScanner, TaskStates

    public interface Task
extends java.lang.Runnable
    Interface that must implement tasks potentially time consuming, normally executed in a separated thread, managed by a task manager and monitored by task monitor.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(TaskListener listener)
      Add a listener to notify task events.
      long countSteps()
      If the task supports pre-counting steps, a call to this method forces counting (and storing) the number of steps.
      void execute()
      Executes the underlying task processing.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAdditionalLabels()
      Returns the list of optional additional labels to trace messages.
      java.util.List<Task> getChildren()
      Returns the list of children tasks when this task is an upper level task made of aa list of tasks.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns the description of the task.
      java.lang.Exception getException()
      Returns the exception occurred and thrown, or null.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Exception> getExceptions()
      Returns the list of exceptions ocurred when processing, not thrown and catched and registered.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the task name.
      Task getParent()
      Returns the parent task when this task is a child of an upper level task.
      long getStep()
      Returns the current executing step.
      long getStepIncrease()
      Returns the increase of steps, because steps are not always notified one by one.
      long getSteps()
      Returns the total number of steps.
      boolean isCancelled()
      Indicates if the task has been cancelled by an external reason, perhaps a user request.
      boolean isCancelSupported()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support cancel requests.
      boolean isCountStepsSupported()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the task supports counting steps through a call to countSteps().
      boolean isException()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the task terminated with an exception.
      boolean isIndeterminate()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate, that is, the task can not count its number of steps.
      boolean isPaused()
      Indicates if the task has been paused, normally by anexternal reason, mainly a user request.
      boolean isPauseSupported()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support the pause/resume requests.
      boolean isProcessing()
      Returns a boolean indicating that the task has started processing and has not terminated.
      boolean isRemoveFromMonitorWhenTerminated()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the task should be removed from the monitor when terminated.
      boolean isTerminated()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the task has terminated, either an exception or cancellation occured or not and the job terminated ok.
      void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
      Set the task description.
      void setMonitor(TaskMonitor monitor)
      Install a task monitor, allowing the task to start monitoring when starting execution and removing it from the monitor when terminated if the task so decides.
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Set the task name.
      void setParent(Task parent)
      Sets the parent task when this task is a child of an upper level task.
      void setRemoveFromMonitorWhenTerminated(boolean remove)
      Set if the task should be removed from the monitor if it has been set.

      • addListener

        Add a listener to notify task events.
        Parameters:

      • countSteps

        long countSteps()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        If the task supports pre-counting steps, a call to this method forces counting (and storing) the number of steps.
        Returns:
        The number of steps.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an unrecoverable error occurs during execution.

        long getStepIncrease()
        Returns the increase of steps, because steps are not always notified one by one.
        Returns:
        The increase of steps.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the task name. It is recomended that the identifier be unique.
        Returns:
        The name.

      • setDescription

        Set the task description.
        Parameters:
        description - The description.

      • setMonitor

        void setMonitor(TaskMonitor monitor)
        Install a task monitor, allowing the task to start monitoring when starting execution and removing it from the monitor when terminated if the task so decides.
        Parameters:
        monitor - The task monitor to install.

      • isRemoveFromMonitorWhenTerminated

        boolean isRemoveFromMonitorWhenTerminated()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task should be removed from the monitor when terminated. Normally top tasks will not be removed, while child task will do.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the task should be removed from the monitor when terminated.

      • setRemoveFromMonitorWhenTerminated

        void setRemoveFromMonitorWhenTerminated(boolean remove)
        Set if the task should be removed from the monitor if it has been set.
        Parameters:
        remove - A boolean.

      • isCancelled

        boolean isCancelled()
        Indicates if the task has been cancelled by an external reason, perhaps a user request.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the task has been cancelled by an external reason, perhaps a user request.

      • isCancelSupported

        boolean isCancelSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support cancel requests.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isCountStepsSupported

        boolean isCountStepsSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task supports counting steps through a call to countSteps().
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isIndeterminate

        boolean isIndeterminate()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate, that is, the task can not count its number of steps.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate.

      • isException

        boolean isException()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task terminated with an exception.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Indicates if the task has been paused, normally by anexternal reason, mainly a user request.
        Returns:
        A boolean that indicates whether the task has been paused, normally by anexternal reason, mainly a user request.

      • isPauseSupported

        boolean isPauseSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support the pause/resume requests.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isProcessing

        boolean isProcessing()
        Returns a boolean indicating that the task has started processing and has not terminated.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isTerminated

        boolean isTerminated()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task has terminated, either an exception or cancellation occured or not and the job terminated ok.
        Returns:
        A boolean.
